meanings.definition: To make (an image) out of focus.
meanings.sent1: She defocused the camera to create a blurry effect.
meanings.sent2: The photographer defocused the background to highlight the subject.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child defocused the picture on purpose to play a prank.
meanings.sent4: Her mind defocused the memories, blurring them like a faded photograph.
meanings.sent5: The artist defocused the painting, turning it into a dreamlike scene.

meanings.sent1: The defocused image was blurry and hard to see.
meanings.sent2: Her defocused vision made it difficult to read the small print.
meanings.sent3: The defocused glasses gave him a comical appearance.
meanings.sent4: The defocused background of the photo added a sense of mystery.
meanings.sent5: The defocused lights created a magical atmosphere in the room.
